thread.section_title: Finance | Business and Finance News | News.com.au
thread.title: Sellers wins on lucky ‘8’ day

author: Brendan Wong
title: Sellers wins on lucky ‘8’ day
text:
IT WAS not a coincidence that a four-bedroom apartment at 8/8 Freeman Place, Carlingford was scheduled for auction on what some buyers consider to be a lucky day.
The eight day of the eight month is a fortuitous day for Chinese house hunters.
In Cantonese and Mandarin the number eight is similar in pronunciation to the word meaning prosperity, or rich.
Across Sydney today, there were 839 auctions, according to Core Logic RP Data. That figure was more than double the number scheduled for the same weekend last year when the Saturday fell on August 9.
The Carlingford apartment on 152sq m sold under the hammer for $740,000.
Six parties registered to compete for the home with bidding starting at $650,000,
Agent David Kim from Century 21 Total Real Estate Eastwood said the reserve was adjusted to $735,000 during the auction.
The buyer was a local Chinese who intended to use the property as an investment.
Mr Kim said the vendor wasn’t Chinese but had deliberately chosen today to sell their property.
“Eight is a lucky number and has a very good meaning,” Mr Kim said.
